verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>,
I have heard<WH8085> many such things<WH7227>: miserable<WH5999> comforters<WH5162> are ye all.
Shall vain<WH7307> words<WH1697> have an end<WH7093>? or what emboldeneth<WH4834> thee that thou answerest<WH6030>?

I also could speak<WH1696> as ye do: if<WH3863> your soul<WH5315> were<WH3426> in my soul's<WH5315> stead, I could heap up<WH2266> words<WH4405> against you, and shake<WH5128> mine head<WH7218> at<WH1119> you.
But I would strengthen<WH553> you with<WH1119> my mouth<WH6310>, and the moving<WH5205> of my lips<WH8193> should asswage<WH2820> your grief.
Though I speak<WH1696>, my grief<WH3511> is not asswaged<WH2820>: and though I forbear<WH2308>, what am I eased<WH1980>?
But now he hath made me weary<WH3811>: thou hast made desolate<WH8074> all my company<WH5712>.
And thou hast filled me with wrinkles<WH7059>, which is a witness<WH5707> against me: and my leanness<WH3585> rising up<WH6965> in me beareth witness<WH6030> to my face<WH6440>.
He teareth<WH2963> me in his wrath<WH639>, who hateth<WH7852> me: he gnasheth<WH2786> upon me with his teeth<WH8127>; mine enemy<WH6862> sharpeneth<WH3913> his eyes<WH5869> upon me.
They have gaped<WH6473> upon me with their mouth<WH6310>; they have smitten<WH5221> me upon the cheek<WH3895> reproachfully<WH2781>; they have gathered<WH4390> themselves together<WH3162> against me.
God<WH410> hath delivered<WH5462> me to the ungodly<WH5760>, and turned me over<WH3399> into the hands<WH3027> of the wicked<WH7563>.
I was at ease<WH7961>, but he hath broken me asunder<WH6565>: he hath also taken<WH270> me by my neck<WH6203>, and shaken me to pieces<WH6327>, and set me up<WH6965> for his mark<WH4307>.
His archers<WH7228> compass me round about<WH5437>, he cleaveth<WH6398> my reins<WH3629> asunder<WH6398>, and doth not spare<WH2550>; he poureth out<WH8210> my gall<WH4845> upon the ground<WH776>.
He breaketh<WH6555> me with breach<WH6556> upon<WH6440> breach<WH6556>, he runneth<WH7323> upon me like a giant<WH1368>.
I have sewed<WH8609> sackcloth<WH8242> upon my skin<WH1539>, and defiled<WH5953> my horn<WH7161> in the dust<WH6083>.
My face<WH6440> is foul<WH2560> with weeping<WH1065>, and on my eyelids<WH6079> is the shadow of death<WH6757>;
Not for any injustice<WH2555> in mine hands<WH3709>: also my prayer<WH8605> is pure<WH2134>.
O earth<WH776>, cover<WH3680> not thou my blood<WH1818>, and let my cry<WH2201> have no place<WH4725>.
Also now, behold, my witness<WH5707> is in heaven<WH8064>, and my record<WH7717> is on high<WH4791>.
My friends<WH7453> scorn<WH3887> me: but mine eye<WH5869> poureth out<WH1811> tears unto God<WH433>.
O that one might plead<WH3198> for a man<WH1397> with God<WH433>, as a man<WH120> pleadeth for his neighbour<WH1121><WH7453>!
When a few<WH4557> years<WH8141> are come<WH857>, then I shall go<WH1980> the way<WH734> whence I shall not return<WH7725>.
